snippet: Ray LaHood, the federal transportation secretary, said the planes were never on a collision course even though they breached distance criteria.
abstract: Federal regulators say they are investigating an episode at Ronald Reagan National Airport near Washington in which three regional jets were allowed to get too close to one another.
lead_paragraph: Ray LaHood, the federal transportation secretary, said the planes were never on a collision course even though they breached distance criteria.

headline.seo: 3 Jets Got Too Close at Reagan National Airport, F.A.A. Says
headline.main: Jets’ Proximity at Airport in Virginia Sets Off Inquiry
headline.print_headline: F.A.A. Says Three Jets Got Too Close at Reagan National and Starts an Inquiry
